001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.modal;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
004import io.cyborgcode.utilities.reflections.ReflectionUtil;
005import org.openqa.selenium.By;
006
007import static io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.config.UiConfigHolder.getUiConfig;
008
009/**
010 * Provides an interface for interacting with modal dialog elements in a UI automation framework,
011 * enabling checks for their presence, retrieval of key content, and closure mechanisms. By using
012 * a {@link ModalComponentType} and the {@link #DEFAULT_TYPE}, implementations can standardize
013 * how modal dialogs are located and controlled.
014 *
015 * <p>Classes implementing this interface will typically rely on Selenium-based operations for
016 * interacting with UI elements, ensuring consistent modal handling regardless of application
017 * structure.
018 *
019 * <p>This interface is suitable for a wide range of modal types and styles, from simple alerts
020 * to more complex dialogs with multiple buttons and sections.
021 *
022 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
023 */
024public interface ModalService {
025
026   ModalComponentType DEFAULT_TYPE = getDefaultType();
027
028   /**
029    * Retrieves the default modal component type.
030    *
031    * @return The default modal component type.
032    */
033   private static ModalComponentType getDefaultType() {
034      try {
035         return ReflectionUtil.findEnumImplementationsOfInterface(ModalComponentType.class,
036               getUiConfig().modalDefaultType(),
037               getUiConfig().projectPackages());
038      } catch (Exception ignored) {
039         return null;
040      }
041   }
042
043   /**
044    * Checks if the modal is currently opened, using the default modal component type.
045    *
046    * @return true if the modal is opened, false otherwise.
047    */
048   default boolean isOpened() {
049      return isOpened(DEFAULT_TYPE);
050   }
051
052   /**
053    * Checks if the modal is currently opened, using the given modal component type.
054    *
055    * @param componentType The specific modal component type.
056    * @return true if the modal is opened, false otherwise.
057    */
058   boolean isOpened(ModalComponentType componentType);
059
060   /**
061    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its text, using the default modal component type.
062    *
063    * @param container       The modal container.
064    * @param modalButtonText The text of the button to click.
065    */
066   default void clickButton(SmartWebElement container, String modalButtonText) {
067      clickButton(DEFAULT_TYPE, container, modalButtonText);
068   }
069
070   /**
071    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its text, using the given modal component type.
072    *
073    * @param componentType   The specific modal component type.
074    * @param container       The modal container.
075    * @param modalButtonText The text of the button to click.
076    */
077   void clickButton(ModalComponentType componentType, SmartWebElement container, String modalButtonText);
078
079   /**
080    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its text, using the default modal component type.
081    *
082    * @param modalButtonText The text of the button to click.
083    */
084   default void clickButton(String modalButtonText) {
085      clickButton(DEFAULT_TYPE, modalButtonText);
086   }
087
088   /**
089    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its text, using the given modal component type.
090    *
091    * @param componentType   The specific modal component type.
092    * @param modalButtonText The text of the button to click.
093    */
094   void clickButton(ModalComponentType componentType, String modalButtonText);
095
096   /**
097    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its locator, using the default modal component type.
098    *
099    * @param modalButtonLocator The locator of the button to click.
100    */
101   default void clickButton(By modalButtonLocator) {
102      clickButton(DEFAULT_TYPE, modalButtonLocator);
103   }
104
105   /**
106    * Clicks a button inside the modal, identified by its locator, using the given modal component type.
107    *
108    * @param componentType      The specific modal component type.
109    * @param modalButtonLocator The locator of the button to click.
110    */
111   void clickButton(ModalComponentType componentType, By modalButtonLocator);
112
113   /**
114    * Retrieves the title of the modal, using the default modal component type.
115    *
116    * @return The title of the modal.
117    */
118   default String getTitle() {
119      return getTitle(DEFAULT_TYPE);
120   }
121
122   /**
123    * Retrieves the title of the modal, using the given modal component type.
124    *
125    * @param componentType The specific modal component type.
126    * @return The title of the modal.
127    */
128   String getTitle(ModalComponentType componentType);
129
130   /**
131    * Retrieves the body text of the modal, using the default modal component type.
132    *
133    * @return The body text of the modal.
134    */
135   default String getBodyText() {
136      return getBodyText(DEFAULT_TYPE);
137   }
138
139   /**
140    * Retrieves the body text of the modal, using the given modal component type.
141    *
142    * @param componentType The specific modal component type.
143    * @return The body text of the modal.
144    */
145   String getBodyText(ModalComponentType componentType);
146
147   /**
148    * Retrieves the content title of the modal, using the default modal component type.
149    *
150    * @return The content title of the modal.
151    */
152   default String getContentTitle() {
153      return getContentTitle(DEFAULT_TYPE);
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Retrieves the content title of the modal, using the given modal component type.
158    *
159    * @param componentType The specific modal component type.
160    * @return The content title of the modal.
161    */
162   String getContentTitle(ModalComponentType componentType);
163
164   /**
165    * Closes the modal, using the default modal component type.
166    */
167   default void close() {
168      close(DEFAULT_TYPE);
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Closes the modal, using the given modal component type.
173    *
174    * @param componentType The specific modal component type.
175    */
176   void close(ModalComponentType componentType);
177}
